intro: Saussurea satowii, commonly known as the Tibetan yellow gentian, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Tibetan Plateau and adjacent regions. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its yellow flowers and robust, hairy stems. The plant typically grows in rocky and arid environments, showcasing adaptations to extreme climatic conditions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Saussurea satowii is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine in some Asian cultures.
